info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 11:24AM MST until August 10 at 2:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Flag Burn Scar in... Southern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 215 PM MST. * At 1124 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen so far just to the north and east of Pine Lake and Hualapai Mountain Park. Additional rainfall amounts of at least 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dw Ranch Road, Blake Ranch Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
